intro: Oenothera canovirens var. cymatilis, commonly known as the clustered evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The species is part of the Onagraceae family, known for its diverse array of flowering plants.
